title: AT&T stock fell to 29-year low on Friday and sank another 6.7% today
description: AT&T, Verizon, Frontier, and Lumen all get hammered after lead-cable reports.

title: JumpCloud, an IT firm serving 200,000 orgs, says it was hacked by nation-state
description: "Extremely targeted" attack involved a data injection into JumpCloud's commands framework.

title: PSA: Google is deleting some old Hangouts photos this week
description: It's hard to say exactly what is getting deleted, but it's easy to download.

title: Dealmaster: Home organization, back-to-school essentials, Lenovo laptops, and more
description: Get started on back-to-school shopping with plenty of deals on essentials and tech.

title: Owners of troubled VanMoof e-bikes get their software keys from rival company
description: Belgian firm Cowboy gives VanMoof owners basic access after one-day hackathon.

title: ‘Elusive’ first-gen 4GB iPhone auctioned for record $190,373
description: Collector pays big for smaller-storage SKU Apple discontinued after 2 months.

title: Eli Lilly drug shown to slow Alzheimer’s progression
description: Dementia experts hail "watershed moment" after trial results for donanemab antibody treatment.

title: Exploring the ingenious science and science fiction of making things invisible
description: Greg Gbur chats about his book Invisibility: The History and Science of How Not to be Seen.

title: Musk admits advertisers haven’t returned to Twitter, ad revenue down 50%
description: Twitter has negative cash flow despite Musk predicting profits last quarter.

title: Former astronaut says it’s “extremely important” to study artificial gravity
description: "We have nothing in between one and zero."

title: Ford gives the F-150 Lightning a big price cut as production ramps up
description: This reverses some recent price increases for Ford's electric pickup truck.

title: After months of competition complaints, Sony agrees to 10-year Call of Duty deal
description: Move helps clear the way for final approval of Microsoft's Activision purchase.

title: How long will the last Intel Macs be supported? macOS Sonoma gives us some hints
description: Nearly 20 years of data show how Intel Macs are faring as Apple switches chips.
